column4: so, does anyone know if/how I can import all my windows-firefox-configs ?
did you try copying your windows profile into ~/.mozilla/firefox/ ?
not yet :#
something like: cp -r /mnt/c/Documents\ and\ Settings/<user>/Application\ Data/Mozilla/Firefox/Profiles/*.default ~/.mozilla/firefox/
(once you've got your windows C drive mounted as /mnt/c, of course)
didn't work :S
rename the profile you copied to be exactly the same as the old profile you removed.  firefox is expecting your profile to be called <random-stuff>.default
aarg, don't know what it was called :s
reading ~/.mozilla/firefox/profiles.ini will tell you
the 'path=' bit
I'll try it here with my old windows firefox profile and see if that works.
I see the same error - that firefox is in use (it isn't)
hmmm
I'll work out what's wrong - give me a minute
I just removed the old ~/mozilla/firefox/ and copied my windows Firefox to it, I just need to rename the folder to see what happens ..
got it :)
HOW? :o
run a "chmod -R u+w <random-junk>.default" to make the profile writable!

good, isn't it?  the problem is, your windows partition was mounted readonly, so when you copied the files, the copies were read-only, too, which meant firefox wasn't able to mark the profile 'in use', so it thought it must already be in use...
that's an old URL.  marillat's repo is now "deb http://www.debian-multimedia.org sid main" - and it's for debian, not ubuntu
where can I find a good package for ubuntu ?
you can use http://www.debian-multimedia.org/pool/main/w/w32codecs/w32codecs_20061022-0.0_i386.deb - since it's only codecs, it probably doesn't matter that it's packaged for debian
